title: CLI: npx neon eval runs tests locally
description: Create the CLI entry point that allows developers to run eval suites locally with 'npx neon eval'. This is the primary developer workflow - define tests in code, run them from the command line, see results in the terminal.
acceptance_criteria: npx neon eval command discovers and runs test files
Supports glob patterns for test file discovery (e.g., **/*.eval.ts)
Console output shows test progress with pass/fail status
Summary at end: total tests, passed, failed, duration
Individual test case results with scorer names and scores
Exit code 0 on all pass, non-zero on any failure
Error handling with clear error messages for common issues
implementation_notes: Use a CLI framework like commander or yargs for argument parsing
The bin field in package.json should point to the CLI entry
Use glob package for test file discovery
Reporter should be pluggable to support SDK-005 (JSON output)
Consider using picocolors for terminal colors (lighter than chalk)
